meaningMnemonic:
A <kanji>writing</kanji> <kanji>chapter</kanji> is just another name for a piece of <vocabulary>writing</vocabulary>, a.k.a. a <vocabulary>composition</vocabulary>. Even if it's only a single <vocabulary>sentence</vocabulary>! <ja>文章</ja> covers just about every type of writing there is.

Although 文章 is pretty versatile, it most often refers to a complete piece of longer writing, like an essay, novel, short story, or poem. But even something super short like a tanka or haiku can be called 文章, as long as it's a complete work by itself.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
